snippet: The 34th president might have been bemused at the bureaucratic retreats and aesthetic flak it has taken to win approval of his memorial.
abstract: Editorial welcomes long-overdue approval of memorial to former Pres Dwight D Eisenhower, tribute that was first approved by Congress 15 years earlier; praises design by Frank Gehry, saying it is worthy of Eisenhower's legacy; speculates that Eisenhower may have been bemused by bureaucratic retreats and aesthetic flak it has taken to win approval.
lead_paragraph: The 34th president might have been bemused at the bureaucratic retreats and aesthetic flak it has taken to win approval of his memorial.
